title: Test
text:
library(utils)
library(taskscheduleR)


Test

taskscheduler_delete("NoPopUp")
taskscheduler_ls()
?taskscheduler_create



3L

#taskscheduler_delete("RepoPull")

# Automated QC
WorkingDirectory <- file.path("C:", "DailyQC", "InstrumentQC")
TheScript <- file.path(WorkingDirectory, "TheScript_3L.R")

taskscheduler_create(taskname = "QC_3L_Morning",
                     rscript=TheScript,
                     schedule="DAILY",
                     startdate = format(Sys.Date(), "%m/%d/%Y"),
                     starttime = "10:30",
                     schtasks_extra = '/RU SYSTEM')

# Automated QC
WorkingDirectory <- file.path("C:", "DailyQC", "InstrumentQC")
TheScript <- file.path(WorkingDirectory, "TheScript_3L.R")

taskscheduler_create(taskname = "QC_3L_Morning_2",
                     rscript=TheScript,
                     schedule="DAILY",
                     startdate = format(Sys.Date(), "%m/%d/%Y"),
                     starttime = "22:00",
                     schtasks_extra = '/RU SYSTEM')

# Flag Removal
WorkingDirectory <- file.path("C:", "DailyQC", "InstrumentQC")
TheFlagScript <- file.path(WorkingDirectory, "FlagRemoval.R")

taskscheduler_create(taskname = "FlagRemoval",
                     rscript=TheFlagScript,
                     schedule="DAILY",
                     startdate = format(Sys.Date(), "%m/%d/%Y"),
                     starttime = "13:00",
                     schtasks_extra = '/RU SYSTEM')

# Repo Pull
WorkingDirectory <- file.path("C:", "DailyQC", "InstrumentQC")
TheRepoPull <- file.path(WorkingDirectory, "RepoPull.R")

taskscheduler_create(taskname = "RepoPull",
                     rscript=TheRepoPull,
                     schedule="DAILY",
                     startdate = format(Sys.Date(), "%m/%d/%Y"),
                     starttime = "06:00",
                     schtasks_extra = '/RU SYSTEM')

title: Types of Measurements
text:
Gain (similar to voltage on certain cytometers) is a unit by which the detected signal is amplified by for each detector. During the Daily QC, gains are adjusted in order to ensure that the MFI of the instrument is maintained to allow for comparison across experiment days. When a laser starts to wear out, the amount of gain needed to keep the MFI stable will increase.
When a gain for any individual detector is twice that of it’s original baseline gain value, it will be marked as having failed during the Daily QC.



When the robust coefficient of variation (rCV) is low, it’s possible to reproducible discern dim staining populations from each other. When the variance is higher, this ability to discern can be lost.
Cytek defines a detector having failed QC when it’s %rCV fail exceeds 6% for the FSC, UV3, V3, B3, YG3, R3 detectors, or 8% for the SSC detectors. When any of the above occurs, it will be marked as having failed Daily QC.
What about in the case of the other detectors (UV1-UV16, etc.)? While they don’t trigger a Daily QC fail in Cytek’s eyes, they can still impact an experiment. In the context of our dashboard, if a greater than 6% rCV is observed for any of these other detectors, they will be marked by the yellow caution/warning designations.



The Mean Fluorescent Intensity (MFI) is based on the measured brightness values across individual detectors for the QC beads acquired during daily QC. Based on these initial MFI results, during Daily QC to Gain is adjusted to ensure that the MFI is stable across time. We can visualize this process by comparing the measurements taken from the before/after QC bead samples.
While Daily QC doesn’t fail due to a change of MFI, we can observe potential issues by checking to see whether the MFI for a given detector is maintained over time, or if it swings wildly over time. This often times coincides with observed QC failure for both the Gain and %rCV measurements.

title: Types of Measurements
text:
Gain (similar to voltage on certain cytometers) is a unit by which the detected signal is amplified by for each detector. During the Daily QC, gains are adjusted in order to ensure that the MFI of the instrument is maintained to allow for comparison across experiment days. When a laser starts to wear out, the amount of gain needed to keep the MFI stable will increase.
When a gain for any individual detector is twice that of it’s original baseline gain value, it will be marked as having failed during the Daily QC.

title: Types of Measurements
text:
When the robust coefficient of variation (rCV) is low, it’s possible to reproducible discern dim staining populations from each other. When the variance is higher, this ability to discern can be lost.
Cytek defines a detector having failed QC when it’s %rCV fail exceeds 6% for the FSC, UV3, V3, B3, YG3, R3 detectors, or 8% for the SSC detectors. When any of the above occurs, it will be marked as having failed Daily QC.
What about in the case of the other detectors (UV1-UV16, etc.)? While they don’t trigger a Daily QC fail in Cytek’s eyes, they can still impact an experiment. In the context of our dashboard, if a greater than 6% rCV is observed for any of these other detectors, they will be marked by the yellow caution/warning designations.

title: Types of Measurements
text:
The Mean Fluorescent Intensity (MFI) is based on the measured brightness values across individual detectors for the QC beads acquired during daily QC. Based on these initial MFI results, during Daily QC to Gain is adjusted to ensure that the MFI is stable across time. We can visualize this process by comparing the measurements taken from the before/after QC bead samples.
While Daily QC doesn’t fail due to a change of MFI, we can observe potential issues by checking to see whether the MFI for a given detector is maintained over time, or if it swings wildly over time. This often times coincides with observed QC failure for both the Gain and %rCV measurements.

title: UMGCC FCSS
text:
Please save the below as .R files for each individual computer. This FlagRemoval.R file is then called by source(FlagRemoval.R) in the TaskSchedule process to remove any generated Flag.csv files at the end of the day, resetting the automatic processing for the next day.

# 3L
Main <- file.path("C:", "DailyQC", "InstrumentQC")
AnyFlags <- list.files(Main, pattern="Flag.csv", full.names=TRUE)

if (!length(AnyFlags) == 0){
  TheCSV <- file.path(Main, "Flag.csv")
  file.remove(TheCSV)
}


# 4L
Main <- file.path("C:", "DailyQC", "InstrumentQC")
AnyFlags <- list.files(Main, pattern="Flag.csv", full.names=TRUE)

if (!length(AnyFlags) == 0){
  TheCSV <- file.path(Main, "Flag.csv")
  file.remove(TheCSV)
}


# 5L
Main <- file.path("C:", "Users", "Aurora", "Documents", "InstrumentQC")
AnyFlags <- list.files(Main, pattern="Flag.csv", full.names=TRUE)

if (!length(AnyFlags) == 0){
  TheCSV <- file.path(Main, "Flag.csv")
  file.remove(TheCSV)
}


# CS
Main <- file.path("C:", "Users", "Aurora CS", "Documents", "InstrumentQC")
AnyFlags <- list.files(Main, pattern="Flag.csv", full.names=TRUE)

if (!length(AnyFlags) == 0){
  TheCSV <- file.path(Main, "Flag.csv")
  file.remove(TheCSV)
}

title: UMGCC FCSS
text:
To manually send the QC data to the server, please click the green play button below to run the chunk of code. If you see that the success message appears in the console below, you have done so successfully.

#3L
Main <- file.path("C:", "DailyQC", "InstrumentQC")
setwd(Main)
TheScript <- file.path(Main, "TheScript_3L.R")
source(TheScript)

Today <- Sys.time()
Today <- as.Date(Today)

Main <- file.path("C:", "DailyQC", "InstrumentQC")
Flag = data.frame(Flag=Today, Status="Success")
TheFlag <- file.path(Main, "Flag.csv")
write.csv(Flag, TheFlag, row.names=FALSE)
#file.remove(TheFlag)


#4L

Main <- file.path("C:", "DailyQC", "InstrumentQC")
setwd(Main)
TheScript <- file.path(Main, "TheScript_4L.R")
source(TheScript)

Today <- Sys.time()
Today <- as.Date(Today)

Main <- file.path("C:", "DailyQC", "InstrumentQC")
Flag = data.frame(Flag=Today, Status="Success")
TheFlag <- file.path(Main, "Flag.csv")
write.csv(Flag, TheFlag, row.names=FALSE)
#file.remove(TheFlag)


Main <- file.path("C:", "Users", "Aurora", "Documents", "InstrumentQC")
setwd(Main)
TheScript <- file.path(Main, "TheScript_5L.R")
source(TheScript)

Today <- Sys.time()
Today <- as.Date(Today)

Main <- file.path("C:", "Users", "Aurora", "Documents", "InstrumentQC")
Flag = data.frame(Flag=Today, Status="Success")
TheFlag <- file.path(Main, "Flag.csv")
write.csv(Flag, TheFlag, row.names=FALSE)
#file.remove(TheFlag)

message("Data Successfully processed")


#CS
Main <- file.path("C:", "Users", "Aurora CS", "Documents", "InstrumentQC")
setwd(Main)
TheScript <- file.path(Main, "TheScript_CS.R")
source(TheScript)

Today <- Sys.time()
Today <- as.Date(Today)

Main <- file.path("C:", "Users", "Aurora CS", "Documents", "InstrumentQC")
Flag = data.frame(Flag=Today, Status="Success")
TheFlag <- file.path(Main, "Flag.csv")
write.csv(Flag, TheFlag, row.names=FALSE)

message("Data successfully sent!")
#file.remove(TheFlag)
